metadata.title: A nonlocal higher order shear deformation theory for electro-elastic analysis of a piezoelectric doubly curved nano shell

sections.text:
Contents lists available at ScienceDirect
Composites Part B
journal homepage: www.elsevier.com/locate/compositesb
A nonlocal higher order shear deformation theory for electro-elastic analysis of a piezoelectric doubly curved nano shell Mohammad Arefia,∗∗, Timon Rabczukb,∗ a Department of Solid Mechanic, Faculty of Mechanical Engineering, University of Kashan, Kashan, 87317-51167, Iran b Institute of Research and Development, Duy Tan University, Da Nang, Viet Nam
A R T I C L E I N F O
Keywords: Higher order shear deformation theory Doubly curved piezoelectric nano shells Nonlocal parameter Applied electric potential
A B S T R A C T
Nonlocal higher order electro-elastic bending analysis of a piezoelectric doubly curved nano shell is studied in this paper based on nonlocal elasticity theory and third order shear deformation theory. Nonlocal piezo-elasticity relations are used for size-dependent analysis of the piezoelectric structure. One can conclude that combination of important theories such as Reddy's shear deformation theory, nonlocal piezoelasticity theory to a more complicated structure such as doubly curved shells leads to an important and novel work in context of mechanical engineering. The kinematic relations are used based on third order shear deformation theory of Reddy. The doubly curved piezoelectric nano shell is subjected to transverse loads and applied voltage. In addition, the structure is resting on Winkler-Pasternak foundation. The governing equations of nonlocal electro-elastic bending are derived based on principle of virtual work. The nonlocal electro-elastic bending results of doubly curved nano shell are investigated using Navier's method. Influence of nonlocal parameter, applied electric potential, Winkler and Pasternak's parameters of foundation is studied on the mechanical and electrical components of the piezoelectric doubly curved nano shell.
1. Introduction
Doubly curved structures are often used in aerospace structures, airplane vehicles and some big construction structures such as stadium domes as a well-known structure. Analysis of doubly curved structures because of complicated geometries and governing equations has not been extensively studied by various researchers. Although some important works on the doubly curved shells were reported, however combination of this topic with some new topics such as small scale structures and intelligent materials has not been studied carefully. In this work, we study electro-elastic analysis of a doubly curved piezoelectric nano shell resting on Pasternak's foundation. Higher order shear deformation theory is used for more accurate analysis of doubly curved piezoelectric nano shell. A comprehensive literature review is presented to show novelty and importance of present work.
Liew and Lim [1] employed higher order shear deformation theory for vibration analysis of thick doubly curved shells based on orthogonal curvilinear coordinate system. For accurate accounting the shear stress along the thickness direction with a parabolic distribution, a third-order shear deformation theory was employed. They concluded that presence of shell curvature leads to unsymmetric shear distribution. Ossadzow
et al. [2] provided a comprehensive study on the deep doubly curved shells based on a two dimensional analysis. The continuity of shear stress and strains was provided in governing equations based on employing a trigonometric function. Amabili and Reddy [3] employed a higher order shear deformation theory for large amplitude vibration analysis of laminaed doubly curved shells with geometric imperfections. In addition, the nonlinearity was accounted based on geometric relations. They studied the influence of various important parameters on the nonlinear vibration responses of the doubly curved nano shells. Librescu and Chang [4] studied vibration analysis of geometrically imperfect single and multilayered composite double-curved shallow panels subjected to transverse loads and various in-plane boundary conditions. The influence of transverse shear deformations, lamination and various in-plane boundary conditions was studied on the responses of doubly curved shell. Some important works on the free vibration analysis of doubly curved shells with various geometries and boundary conditions in macro and nano scales have been reported by researchers [5–7]. Thakur et al. [8] presented a more accurate higher-order displacement field for the analysis of a doubly curved laminated composite shell based on finite element analysis. The proposed model was capable of determining the accurate shear stress distribution across the

thickness of the laminate. Kant and Punera [9] presented static and dynamic analysis of doubly curved shells based on higher order shear and normal deformation theory with twelve middle surface displacement parameters. A variational principle based on minimization of energy was used to derive the set of governing differential equations and associated boundary conditions.
First order shear deformation theory was used for free vibration analysis of laminated composite doubly curved shells by Chandrashekhar [10]. The numerical results have been presented in terms of shell geometry, orientation of layers, material parameters, and boundary conditions. Tsai et al. [11] used extended Love–Kirchhoffs' assumptions for magneto-electro-elastic static analysis of doubly curved functionally graded shells. Pradyumna and Bandyopadhyay [12] studied dynamic stability analysis of functionally graded shells subjected to in-plane periodic load and temperature field using a higher-order shear deformation theory in conjunction with the finite-element approach. Temperature dependency was accounted for material properties. They studied five forms of shells including singly curved cylindrical, doubly curved spherical, and hyperbolic paraboloid having two principal curvatures, doubly curved hyper having twist curvature only, and doubly curved conoid having one curvature and twist curvature. Effects of material composition and geometrical parameters were studied on the dynamic instability characteristics of the shells. Viola et al. [13] provided a general framework for dynamic computations of moderately thick laminated doubly-curved shells and panels based on a 2D higher-order shear deformation theory. They presented the required formulations for differential geometry and arbitrary shape of the middle surface of shells and panels with different curvatures. They summarized the efficiency and trueness of their formulations using higher order shear deformation theory respect to first order shear deformation theory. The governing equations of motion for magneto-electro-mechanical analysis of an arbitrary shell or revolution were studied by Arefi [14] using tensor analysis and curvilinear coordinate system. Finite element formulation of laminated, composite and sandwich shells based on linear and nonlinear geometric relations was studied by Kant and Kommineni [15] based on higher order shear deformation theory. The effect of various boundary conditions has been studied on the numerical results. The effect of applied electric potential and viscoelastic foundation was studied on the size dependent analysis of sandwich nano plates including piezoelectric layers [16]. Application of sinusoidal shear deformation theory was performed to electro elastic analysis of functionally graded piezoelectric plates based on the concept of neutral surface [17].
The effect of geometric nonlinearity was studied on the nonlinear vibration analysis of laminated composite shell panels integrated with the piezoelectric fiber reinforced composite based on higher-order shear deformation theory by Singh et al. [18]. Nonlinear primary resonance of nano beam subjected to axial initial load based on nonlocal continuum theory was studied by Wang and Li [19]. The results have been presented in terms of small scale parameter, axial initial load, mode number, Winkler foundation modulus and the ratio of the length to the diameter. Free vibration analysis of functionally graded nanoplates reinforced with graphene nanoplatelets was studied by Arefi et al. [20]. Vibrational analysis of functionally graded composite doubly curved reinforced by carbon nanotube was studied by Pouresmaeeli and Fazelzadeh [21] based on first-order shear deformation theory and Galerkin's method. The numerical results have been presented in terms of volume fraction of carbon nanotubes, thickness ratio, aspect ratio, curvature ratio and shallowness ratio. Some important works on the electro elastic bending and vibration analysis of sandwich structures based on nonlocal elasticity theory and various shear deformation theory has been published [22,23]. Van et al. [24,25] studied effect of porosity and nonlinear strains on the nonlinear transient responses of functionally graded nanoplate based on an isogeometric analysis. In another work, the effect of thermal loads has been studied on the nonlinear transient responses of functionally graded carbon
nanotubes reinforced composite nanoplates [26,27]. To account size dependency in constitutive relations. Thanh [28] employed modified couple stress for size dependent isogeometric analysis of functionally graded carbon nanotubes reinforced composite nanoplates. Some important works on the application of higher order shear deformation theory such as four unknown shear and normal deformation theory and generalized layerwise higher order shear deformation theory have been presented by Thai et al. [29–31] and Tran et al. [32].
Vu-Bac et al. [33] provided a sensitivity analysis for quantifying the influence of uncertain input parameters on uncertain model outputs. The effectiveness of this study were highlighted using numerical studies based on analytical functions. Hamida et al. [34] provided a sensitivity analysis for identification of key input parameters affecting energy conversion factor of flexoelectric materials. The numerical results indicated that the flexoelectric constants are the most dominant factors influencing the uncertainties in the energy conversion factor. Ghasemi et al. [35] presented a computational methodology for topology optimization of multi-material-based flexoelectric composites. They provided some numerical examples for two, three and four phase flexoelectric composites to demonstrate the flexibility of the model that can be obtained using multi-material topology optimization for flexoelectric composites. Some related works to optimization and computational methods of flexoelectric and piezoelectric structures were studied by various researchers [36–40]. Application of computational methods to nonlinear and large deformation analyses this shell structures was provided in References [41,42].
Authors have presented a comprehensive literature review on the analysis of doubly curved elastic and piezoelectric shells in macro, micro and nano scales. In addition, a complete review on the higher order shear deformation theory was performed. One can see that there is no published work on the higher order shear deformation analysis of doubly curved piezoelectric nano shells. In this work, higher order shear deformation theory, nonlocal elasticity theory, piezoelasticity relations and principle of virtual work are used for derivation of the governing equations of electro-elastic bending analysis of doubly curved piezoelectric nano shells. To account size dependency effect on the electro-elastic bending results, Eringen nonlocal elasticity theory is employed. The governing equations are derived based on the principle of virtual work. The numerical results are presented based on analytical method to investigate the effect of important parameters such as nonlocal parameter, applied electric potential, two opening angles of doubly curved and two parameters of Pasternak's foundation on the results.
2. Higher order nonlocal formulation of doubly curved piezoelectric nano shells
Before presentation of the governing equations of the problem and description of constitutive relations, brief physical characteristics of the problem are presented. The present problem is a doubly curved nano shell with thickness h and side lengths L L,1 2. Two principle radii of curvature are depicted with R R,1 2. The shell is subjected to applied electric potential while is resting on Pasternak's foundation. In addition it is assumed that the nano shell is constrained with four simply supported boundary conditions.
The basic relations of electro-elastic bending based on higher order shear deformation theory and nonlocal elasticity theory are derived using principle of virtual work. The schematic of doubly curved piezoelectric nano shell is presented in Fig. 1. This figure is including coordinate, geometry and applied electric potential of structure.
Based on Fig. 1, x x z, ,1 2 are indicated coordinates along two planar and thickness direction. Two radii of curvature are defined R R,1 2. Third order (Reddy's) shear deformation theory is used in this work for description of displacement field.

4.1. Comparison and validation
A comprehensive comparison between present numerical results and previous numerical results [43] is presented in this section for validation of present results. For this comparison, the non-dimensional deflection is selected as:
E w h a pm c 2
In which Em is modulus of elasticity of metal, wc is center deflection, h is thickness, a is side length and p is uniform transverse load [43]. Table 1 lists comparison between present non-dimensional deflection of plate with those results of Reference [43] for defined conditions. The numerical results indicate that the present numerical results are in good agreement with results of literature.
Shown in Fig. 2 is distribution of dimensionless transverse deflection W̄ of piezoelectric doubly curved nano shell in terms of nonlocal parameters µ(nm) and applied electric potentials 0. The numerical results show that the dimensionless transverse deflection W̄ of piezoelectric doubly curved nano shell is increased significantly with increase of nonlocal parameter. It is concluded that this decrease is due to decrease of stiffness of structure that leads to increase of deflections with increase of nonlocal parameter. It is concluded that this conclusion is accordance with results of previous works [22,23]. In addition,
investigation on the influence of applied electric potentials 0 on the transverse deflection indicates that with increase of applied voltage, W̄ is increased significantly. One can see that increase of deflection due to increase of nonlocal parameter and applied electric potential is in accordance with results of previous references [22,23].
Fig. 3 shows variation of dimensionless in-plane deformation Ū of piezoelectric doubly curved nano shell in terms of nonlocal parameters µ(nm) and applied electric potentials 0. The numerical results indicate that with increase of nonlocal parameters µ(nm) and applied electric potentials 0, the in-plane deformations are increased significantly. It is confirmed that with increase of nonlocal parameter, stiffness of nano shell is decreased and consequently the deformations are increased.
Shown in Fig. 4 is variation of rotation component ¯ of piezoelectric
doubly curved nano shell in terms of nonlocal parameter for various applied electric potential. The numerical results indicate that with increase of nonlocal parameter, the stiffness of nano shell is decreased and consequently the rotation component is increased significantly. In addition, increase of applied electric potential leads to decrease of stiffness and increase of rotation components.
Shown in Fig. 5 is variation of maximum electric potential of doubly curved nano shell in terms of nonlocal parameter and applied electric potential. It is observed that maximum electric potentials are increased with increase of nonlocal parameter and applied electric potential. It is concluded that with increase of nonlocal parameter and applied electric potentials, the stiffness of structure is decreased, the deflections are increased and consequently the maximum electric potential is increased significantly.
The effect of geometries of doubly curved nano shell is studied on
the electro-elastic bending results. Two opening angles are defined as: = =L /R , L /R1 1 1 2 2 2. Shown in Figs. 6 and 7 are variation of dimensionless transverse deflection and in-plane deformation in terms of two defined opening angles ,1 2. The variation of transverse deflection indicates that these parameters are increased with decrease of 1 and increase of 2. To investigate the influence of opening angle on the electro-elastic bending results, the both curved lengths of doubly curved are assumed constant. Variation of in-plane deformation indicates that this component is increased with increase of 1 and decrease of 2. Fig. 8 shows variation of rotation component in terms of two defined opening angles ,1 2. It is observed that the rotation components are increased with decrease of 1 and increase of 2. Shown in Fig. 9 is variation of maximum electric potential of doubly curved piezoelectric nano shell in terms of two defined opening angles ,1 2. The numerical results indicate that the maximum electric potentials are increased with decrease of 1 and increase of 2.
Figs. 10–13 show variation of transverse and in-plane deformations, rotation and maximum electric potential in terms of two parameters of Pasternak's foundation. The numerical results indicate that with increase of spring and shear parameters of foundation, the stiffness is increased and consequently all outputs including in-plane and transverse displacements, rotation component and maximum electric potential are decreased significantly.
5. Conclusion
Higher order shear deformation theory and Eringen's nonlocal elasticity theory was used to derive size-dependent electro-elastic analysis of doubly curved nano shell subjected to mechanical and electrical loads resting on Pasternak's foundation. The kinematic
relations are provided using third order shear deformation theory of Reddy. The principle of virtual work is used to derive governing equations in terms of three displacement components of middle surface, two rotation components and one electric potential. The analytical method is proposed for solution of the problem based on Fourier series for simply supported doubly curved nano shell. The numerical results such as displacements, rotations and maximum electric potential are provided to show the influence of significant parameters such as nonlocal parameter, two opening angles of doubly curved shell, WinklerPasternak's parameter of foundation and applied electric potential on the variation of displacements, rotations and electric potential. Some main conclusions of this study are expressed as:
In-plane and out of plane deformations, rotation components and maximum electric potential has been plotted in terms of nonlocal parameter. The numerical results indicate that increase of this parameter leads to increase of these components. One can conclude that
with increase of nonlocal parameter, the stiffness of nano shell is decreased and consequently the displacement components, rotation component and maximum electric potential are increased significantly.
The doubly curved piezoelectric nano shell was subjected to applied electric potential, the change of applied electric potential leads to significant changes of deformation, rotation and maximum electric potential, the numerical results indicate that with increase of applied electric potential, in-plane and transverse displacements, rotations and maximum electric potential are increased significantly.
Two opening angles of doubly curved shell have significant effect on the obtained results. It is concluded that transverse deflection, rotation component and maximum electric potential are increased with decrease of 1 and increase of 2. Conversely it is observed that in-plane deformation is increased with increase of 1 and decrease of 2.
In addition, the Winkler's parameter of foundation significantly changes the results. The numerical results show that increase of this parameter leads to decrease of displacements and rotations.

referenceMentions.context: Liew and Lim [1] employed higher order shear deformation theory for vibration analysis of thick doubly curved shells based on orthogonal curvilinear coordinate system.
[2] provided a comprehensive study on the deep doubly curved shells based on a two dimensional analysis.
Amabili and Reddy [3] employed a higher order shear deformation theory for large amplitude vibration analysis of laminaed doubly curved shells with geometric imperfections.

Librescu and Chang [4] studied vibration analysis of geometrically imperfect single and multilayered composite double-curved shallow panels subjected to transverse loads and various in-plane boundary conditions.
[8] presented a more accurate higher-order displacement field for the analysis of a doubly curved laminated composite shell based on finite element analysis.
Kant and Punera [9] presented static and dynamic analysis of doubly curved shells based on higher order shear and normal deformation theory with twelve middle surface displacement parameters.
First order shear deformation theory was used for free vibration analysis of laminated composite doubly curved shells by Chandrashekhar [10].
[11] used extended Love–Kirchhoffs' assumptions for magneto-electro-elastic static analysis of doubly curved functionally graded shells.

Pradyumna and Bandyopadhyay [12] studied dynamic stability analysis of functionally graded shells subjected to in-plane periodic load and temperature field using a higher-order shear deformation theory in conjunction with the finite-element approach.
[13] provided a general framework for dynamic computations of moderately thick laminated doubly-curved shells and panels based on a 2D higher-order shear deformation theory.
The governing equations of motion for magneto-electro-mechanical analysis of an arbitrary shell or revolution were studied by Arefi [14] using tensor analysis and curvilinear coordinate system.

Finite element formulation of laminated, composite and sandwich shells based on linear and nonlinear geometric relations was studied by Kant and Kommineni [15] based on higher order shear deformation theory.
The effect of applied electric potential and viscoelastic foundation was studied on the size dependent analysis of sandwich nano plates including piezoelectric layers [16].
Application of sinusoidal shear deformation theory was performed to electro elastic analysis of functionally graded piezoelectric plates based on the concept of neutral surface [17].
Nonlinear primary resonance of nano beam subjected to axial initial load based on nonlocal continuum theory was studied by Wang and Li [19].

Vibrational analysis of functionally graded composite doubly curved reinforced by carbon nanotube was studied by Pouresmaeeli and Fazelzadeh [21] based on first-order shear deformation theory and Galerkin's method.
Some important works on the electro elastic bending and vibration analysis of sandwich structures based on nonlocal elasticity theory and various shear deformation theory has been published [22,23].
Some important works on the electro elastic bending and vibration analysis of sandwich structures based on nonlocal elasticity theory and various shear deformation theory has been published [22,23].
[24,25] studied effect of porosity and nonlinear strains on the nonlinear transient responses of functionally graded nanoplate based on an isogeometric analysis.
[24,25] studied effect of porosity and nonlinear strains on the nonlinear transient responses of functionally graded nanoplate based on an isogeometric analysis.
In another work, the effect of thermal loads has been studied on the nonlinear transient responses of functionally graded carbon nanotubes reinforced composite nanoplates [26,27].
In another work, the effect of thermal loads has been studied on the nonlinear transient responses of functionally graded carbon nanotubes reinforced composite nanoplates [26,27].
Thanh [28] employed modified couple stress for size dependent isogeometric analysis of functionally graded carbon nanotubes reinforced composite nanoplates.
[33] provided a sensitivity analysis for quantifying the influence of uncertain input parameters on uncertain model outputs.
[34] provided a sensitivity analysis for identification of key input parameters affecting energy conversion factor of flexoelectric materials.
[35] presented a computational methodology for topology optimization of multi-material-based flexoelectric composites.
Application of computational methods to nonlinear and large deformation analyses this shell structures was provided in References [41,42].
Application of computational methods to nonlinear and large deformation analyses this shell structures was provided in References [41,42].

metadata.abstractText: Nonlocal higher order electro-elastic bending analysis of a piezoelectric doubly curved nano shell is studied in this paper based on nonlocal elasticity theory and third order shear deformation theory. Nonlocal piezo-elasticity relations are used for size-dependent analysis of the piezoelectric structure. One can conclude that combination of important theories such as Reddy's shear deformation theory, nonlocal piezoelasticity theory to a more complicated structure such as doubly curved shells leads to an important and novel work in context of mechanical engineering. The kinematic relations are used based on third order shear deformation theory of Reddy. The doubly curved piezoelectric nano shell is subjected to transverse loads and applied voltage. In addition, the structure is resting on Winkler-Pasternak foundation. The governing equations of nonlocal electro-elastic bending are derived based on principle of virtual work. The nonlocal electro-elastic bending results of doubly curved nano shell are investigated using Navier's method. Influence of nonlocal parameter, applied electric potential, Winkler and Pasternak's parameters of foundation is studied on the mechanical and electrical components of the piezoelectric doubly curved nano shell.
